de.slothsoft.charts.piechart

Class PieChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.slothsoft.charts.Chart
      • de.slothsoft.charts.piechart.PieChart

  • public class PieChart
extends Chart
    This class represents a Chart that displays a circle with sections representing percentages. It's structure looks like this:
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Stef Schulz

      • getPieColor

        public int getPieColor()
        Returns the color of the pie as ARGB int, e.g. red is 0xFFFF0000 and blue is 0xFF0000FF.
        Returns:
        the color

      • getPieBorder

        public double getPieBorder()
        Returns the pie's border size. The border is drawn in the getPieColor().
        Returns:
        the border's size
        See Also:

      • getStartAngle

        public double getStartAngle()
        Returns the angle the pie starts drawing its slices. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation.
        Returns:
        the start angle

      • startAngle

        public PieChart startAngle(double newStartAngle)
        Sets the angle the pie starts drawing its slices. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation.
        Parameters:
        newStartAngle - the start angle
        Returns:
        this instance

      • setStartAngle

        public void setStartAngle(double startAngle)
        Sets the angle the pie starts drawing its slices. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation.
        Parameters:
        startAngle - the start angle
